title: How does believing in yourself help? - Quora

response.answer_text: It's really quite simple. If you don't think you can do something, then why would you do it? When I began training to play football, some of the more experienced players came over to teach me how to lift. When we got to power cleans, I could barely pick up the bar off the ground. Some of the other guys were doing 2 or 3 plates on each side. For the uninitiated, that’s 225 to 315 pounds. I couldn't do 95 pounds. I was discouraged, and always skipped power cleans when they came up in the workout rotation, because I simply didn't think I could do it. At the beginning of the next season, we had to test the maximum amount we could lift on each of our exercises, including power cleans, which I dreaded. However, after my coach showed me the proper technique, I was able to do 155 pounds with ease. I had been strong enough to lift 155 pounds the entire time, but I just didn't know it. I encounter similar situations all of the time, and whenever I think I can't do something, I think of power cleans. We usually live up to our own expectations. If you truly believe that you can succeed at something, then you will find a way.

The key to success in anything that you do is “you” yourself. This is because, it is only you who knows what your strengths are and where your weaknesses lie. As a result, what may seem to be impossible to many may be possible for you because of the self-belief which comes from you knowing yourself well. The belief in self is more pronounced in situations which demand that you be on top of things or simply put do-or-die situations. This is on account of the fact that you back yourself to make the right decision because of your knowledge of self whence others are not too sure about it. Additionally, since it is a situation wherein you are running the show, it may not be possible for everyone to get the entire picture. Thus belief in yourself will go a long way when it comes to making tough decisions.

Three major ways: You are more willing to do act and take risks. This is a good thing because we live in a generally safe environment. In a world of minefields or sabre tooth tigers wimpy people might have survival advantage but in modern developed world in most fields some bravery is a good thing.Because of the way you speak and act, you appear as more competent and powerful to other people. In very often an advantage in career and relationships.Less stress related to fear of failure and feeling of inadequacy - both of which might hinder you in life.

There is a psychological concept of Locus of Control. You either have an internal locus of control, or external locus of control. a person with an external locus of control has the limiting belief that they are in a sort, helpless. They have no influence on the events around them, and have no agency to control the world around them. They believe it’s the external world that has power over them. A person with an internal locus of control believes that they can influence the outcome of the events around them. they believe it’s them, and the strength to change the world comes from within, or internally. To believe in yourself is a euphemism for having an internal locus of control. In studies it’s shown that people with an internal locus of control are more achievement oriented, which makes sense, right? If you have an external locus of control, you would not have motivation to go into the world since you have the limiting belief that you can’t change anything. So to believe in yourself, is to active yourself to your own self-agency to be performative. That said, people with an external locus of control can be perfectly happy people.

It helps motivate you. Without motivation, it is very hard to do things. If you believe in yourself, you believe that you can accomplish things that you try to do. And so you try. Maybe you'll fail, but you gave it a go and you learned something. You might try again, and find that this time find that you are successful. And now you know that if you try, you can be successful. If you don't believe in yourself, you won't try.

Because only you can. You are the only person on the planet who is not going to do anything willingly that harms you. The one person you care about more than anything is ‘you’. You are the one who can make your name unforgettable for the decades and centuries. Believe in you. Once you start believing yourself and your decisions, you are no longer worried about the consequences and then you have total command on the action. What could be worse than following other’s choice & idea and then failing and then cursing them and self for accepting that. Make your plan. Create a path. Walk. What is you fail? There is a lot to learn. You will learn and walk again. Listen, there is nothing like losing. You either win or learn something. Believe in yourself. Because yes, only you can.
